intro: Phyllanthus insulae-japen, commonly known as the island milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its latex sap contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
